title: How to Make Nacho Cheese Sauce

steps.headline: Pour the milk into the saucepan.
steps.description: Heat over medium heat. When bubbles begin to form, remove from the heat.

steps.headline: Add the butter to the other saucepan.
Sprinkle flour into the melted butter.
steps.description: Stir to form a thickened paste.

steps.headline: Pour the warm milk into the flour paste.
steps.description: Pour in gradually, whisking in the milk as you tip it. The sauce will thicken over 5 minutes, as you continue to stir.

steps.headline: Add the cheese to the thickened mixture.
steps.description: Whisk through to help it melt in.

steps.headline: Tip in the hot sauce and cayenne pepper.
steps.description: Stir through. Then season with salt and pepper to taste. Do a taste test; add more of any of these seasonings if needed.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: Pour the sauce over the pre-arranged nachos.

steps.headline: Place the cornstarch and cheese into the saucepan.
steps.description: Stir together to coat the cheese with the cornstarch.

steps.headline: Add 1 cup of evaporated milk, along with the hot sauce and salt.
Heat over a medium-low heat.
steps.description: Stir frequently, to combine and prevent lumps from forming. Continue to cook until the sauce thickens.

steps.headline: Remove from the heat.
steps.description: When the sauce has thickened and is bubbling, it's ready to take off the heat.

steps.headline: Pour in the remaining evaporated milk if necessary.
steps.description: This will help to thin the consistency, so only add small amounts at a time, until you're satisfied with the sauce's texture.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: Pour over pre-arranged nachos and serve straight away.

methods.name: Spicy meat and cheese nacho sauce

steps.headline: Chop the onion in small pieces.
Brown the ground beef and sausage.
steps.description: Drain the liquid and add the onion pieces until they look translucent in color.

steps.headline: Melt the cheese over a low heat.
Add the jalapeno relish and cream of mushroom soup to the cheese mixture.
Add the meat mixture to the cheese mixture and stir thoroughly.
Serve in a cup as a side item or drizzle the cheese sauce over a plate of nachos.
Process the cashew nuts in the food processor.
steps.description: Pulse to finely grind; you don't want them to form a paste. When finely ground, add the nutritional yeast, onion powder, salt, garlic powder and ground pepper. Pulse a few more times to incorporate these ingredients.

steps.headline: Pour the non-dairy milk into the saucepan.
steps.description: Add the agar and oil. Bring to a simmer over low heat.

steps.headline: Reduce the heat to medium-low and let simmer for about 10 more minutes.
steps.description: You'll need to stir now and then. Heat until the agar dissolves.

steps.headline: Turn the food processor on again and slowly pour the liquid into the cashew mixture.
steps.description: Process for 2 minutes, until it turns creamy and is free of lumps.

steps.headline: Add the miso and lemon juice.
steps.description: Process this into the cashew mixture until combined.

steps.headline: Pour over the pre-prepared nachos.
steps.description: Sprinkle some greenery garnish on top to complete the effect.

text: Basic nacho cheese sauce Pour the milk into the saucepan. Heat over medium heat. When bubbles begin to form, remove from the heat. Add the butter to the other saucepan. Melt over medium-low heat. Sprinkle flour into the melted butter. Stir to form a thickened paste. Pour the warm milk into the flour paste. Pour in gradually, whisking in the milk as you tip it. The sauce will thicken over 5 minutes, as you continue to stir. Add the cheese to the thickened mixture. Whisk through to help it melt in. Tip in the hot sauce and cayenne pepper. Stir through. Then season with salt and pepper to taste. Do a taste test; add more of any of these seasonings if needed. Serve. Pour the sauce over the pre-arranged nachos. Pepper Jack nacho cheese sauce Place the cornstarch and cheese into the saucepan. Stir together to coat the cheese with the cornstarch. Add 1 cup of evaporated milk, along with the hot sauce and salt.  Heat over a medium-low heat. Stir frequently, to combine and prevent lumps from forming. Continue to cook until the sauce thickens. Remove from the heat. When the sauce has thickened and is bubbling, it's ready to take off the heat. Pour in the remaining evaporated milk if necessary. This will help to thin the consistency, so only add small amounts at a time, until you're satisfied with the sauce's texture. Serve. Pour over pre-arranged nachos and serve straight away. Spicy meat and cheese nacho sauce Chop the onion in small pieces.  Brown the ground beef and sausage. Drain the liquid and add the onion pieces until they look translucent in color. Melt the cheese over a low heat.  Add the jalapeno relish and cream of mushroom soup to the cheese mixture.  Add the meat mixture to the cheese mixture and stir thoroughly.  Serve in a cup as a side item or drizzle the cheese sauce over a plate of nachos.  Vegan no-cheese nacho sauce Process the cashew nuts in the food processor. Pulse to finely grind; you don't want them to form a paste. When finely ground, add the nutritional yeast, onion powder, salt, garlic powder and ground pepper. Pulse a few more times to incorporate these ingredients. Pour the non-dairy milk into the saucepan. Add the agar and oil. Bring to a simmer over low heat. Reduce the heat to medium-low and let simmer for about 10 more minutes. You'll need to stir now and then. Heat until the agar dissolves. Turn the food processor on again and slowly pour the liquid into the cashew mixture. Process for 2 minutes, until it turns creamy and is free of lumps. Add the miso and lemon juice. Process this into the cashew mixture until combined. Pour over the pre-prepared nachos. Sprinkle some greenery garnish on top to complete the effect.
sentences: Basic nacho cheese sauce Pour the milk into the saucepan.
Heat over medium heat.
When bubbles begin to form, remove from the heat.
Add the butter to the other saucepan.
Melt over medium-low heat.
Sprinkle flour into the melted butter.
Stir to form a thickened paste.
Pour the warm milk into the flour paste.
Pour in gradually, whisking in the milk as you tip it.
The sauce will thicken over 5 minutes, as you continue to stir.
Add the cheese to the thickened mixture.
Whisk through to help it melt in.
Tip in the hot sauce and cayenne pepper.
Stir through.
Then season with salt and pepper to taste.
Do a taste test; add more of any of these seasonings if needed.
Serve.
Pour the sauce over the pre-arranged nachos.
Pepper Jack nacho cheese sauce Place the cornstarch and cheese into the saucepan.
Stir together to coat the cheese with the cornstarch.
Add 1 cup of evaporated milk, along with the hot sauce and salt.
Heat over a medium-low heat.
Stir frequently, to combine and prevent lumps from forming.
Continue to cook until the sauce thickens.
Remove from the heat.
When the sauce has thickened and is bubbling, it's ready to take off the heat.
Pour in the remaining evaporated milk if necessary.
This will help to thin the consistency, so only add small amounts at a time, until you're satisfied with the sauce's texture.
Serve.
Pour over pre-arranged nachos and serve straight away.
Spicy meat and cheese nacho sauce Chop the onion in small pieces.
Brown the ground beef and sausage.
Drain the liquid and add the onion pieces until they look translucent in color.
Melt the cheese over a low heat.
Add the jalapeno relish and cream of mushroom soup to the cheese mixture.
Add the meat mixture to the cheese mixture and stir thoroughly.
Serve in a cup as a side item or drizzle the cheese sauce over a plate of nachos.
Vegan no-cheese nacho sauce Process the cashew nuts in the food processor.
Pulse to finely grind; you don't want them to form a paste.
When finely ground, add the nutritional yeast, onion powder, salt, garlic powder and ground pepper.
Pulse a few more times to incorporate these ingredients.
Pour the non-dairy milk into the saucepan.
Add the agar and oil.
Bring to a simmer over low heat.
Reduce the heat to medium-low and let simmer for about 10 more minutes.
You'll need to stir now and then.
Heat until the agar dissolves.
Turn the food processor on again and slowly pour the liquid into the cashew mixture.
Process for 2 minutes, until it turns creamy and is free of lumps.
Add the miso and lemon juice.
Process this into the cashew mixture until combined.
Pour over the pre-prepared nachos.
Sprinkle some greenery garnish on top to complete the effect.
tyn_section: Wooden spoon or other implement for stirring
